title: Washington-Rochambeau National Historic Trail: Park Home
body: The Route to Victory  In 1781, General Rochambeau’s French Army joined forces with General Washington’s Continental Army to fight the British Army in Yorktown, Virginia. With the French Navy in support, the allied armies moved hundreds of miles to become the largest troop movement of the American Revolution. The effort and cooperation between the two sides led to a victory at Yorktown and secured American independence. Read More             Explore the Trail   The NHT connects major metropolitan areas, national and state parks, historic and scenic trails, and historic sites.  Start exploring!
